setup.question: How did the planet of Niobe compare to others that Earth was exploring?
answers: It was one of several planets being considered for colonization
It was one of the most interesting

Text.text: B seems to more directly answer the question, but also seems like a kind of uninteresting answer..? Not sure.
is the organization which our main character is exploring Niobe for, and to them
. Despite the planet's rough terrain, the exploration continued
waiting to find other planets to inhabit. The narrator even explains the process goes

There are no other planets considered as there are no others with this unique plant. As such, Niobe is an exceptional planet that is, by nature, highly scientifically interesting and significant

A few questions to settle:
— Is Niobe being considered *for colonization*? (Required for A to be true.) Neither debater has directly addressed this issue, except A saying the terrain is rough and "exploitation" means colonization. But by B's argument, it sounds like "exploitation" is probably referring to viscaya.
— Are there other planets being considered for colonization? (Also required for A to be true.)
— Are there other planets that are more interesting than Niobe? (If so, this would be evidence against B.)

Absent all of these, it sounds pretty clear that B is true, which would make it the preferred answer.
In regard to proof of consideration for colonization, the narrator describes that in following his investigation of the coveted Gerontin,

, showing desire of sustainable living on the planet. 

In regard to other planets, the narrator describes how

, drained as to their resources, making them unsustainable for life, necessitating the colonization of Niobe. 

Other planets named include the
, which like Niobe have not been drained. We don't hear any more about these other planets, so there is no way to definitively say Niobe is more interesting

A lies a lot in their speech.

The proof for colonization is a quote observing that the natives aren't adept at technology. It has nothing to do with colonization. The evidence even specifies "native mechanic":
The "drainage of resources" is actually about draining swamps:
The "other planets mentioned" are not considered for colonization, they are in the confederation. The quote comments on their climate:
Literally everything in As last speech was either out of context or a lie. A has shown no other planets and not proven colonization.
Yeah, that settles it. A's case was weak and B has convincingly pointed out lots of lies.
i think B makes more sense just cause A is just the squo
A seems pretty compelling logically but im not a fan of the quotes that are being used for this like they're lowkey just not helpful
since B calls out all of the lies I think I am more inclined to believe them

answers.other: Maybe I could have decided sooner, even. but first round is a lot to go for.
answers.reason for outcome: A's case was weak and contained a bunch of lies, especially in the last round; B had a decent case and pointed out the lies effectively.
A wasn't mentioned at all in the story so I had to stretch for evidence, so B won.
A made a lot of critical lies that made them seem dishonest

I think since there was alot of lies presented by B I was able to rule A out, however i was definitely confused throughout the entire debate and that could have been from unclear judging that being said i appreciated the previous judges comments because it helped me c contextualize the debate more
